_meanings:
{@--1@} Practicable, 
feasible, possible.
{@--2@} Proper, fit, right.

{@--3@}
Strong, vigorous.

{@--1@} A sacred precept or rule,
law, ordinance.

{@--3@} (Hence) A
proposal, suggestion, resolve, 
determination; {#udAraH kalpaH#} <ls>Ś. 7.</ls>

{@--5@} End of the world,
universal destruction.

{@--6@} A day of
Brahmā or 1,000 Yugas, being a
period of 432 million years of
mortals and measuring the duration
of the world; {#SrISvetavArAhakalpe#} (the
one in which we now live); {#kalpaM#}
{#sTitaM tanuBftAM tanuBistataH kim#}  
<ls>Śānti. 4. 2.</ls>

{@--7@} Medical treatment of the
sick.

{@--8@} One of the six Vedāṅgas,
{%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} that which lays down the
ritual and prescribes rules for 
ceremonial and sacrificial acts; see under
{#vedAMga#}.

{@--10@} The
doctrine of poisons and antidotes.

{@--11@} One of the trees of paradise;
<ab>cf.</ab> {#kalpadruma#}.

A kind of 
intoxicating liquor.

end of the world, universal 
destruction; <ls>Bh. 2. 16.</ls>

{%<ab>a.</ab>%}
lasting to the end of a {#kalpa#}.

renovation of all things in the 
creation.

{1} author of 
Kalpasūtra, <ab>q. v.</ab>
{2} a barber.

{1} a protector of order.
{2} a seller of spirituous liquors.

{1} a creeper of Indra's
paradise: <ls>Bh. 1. 90.</ls>

conversant with sacred precepts;  
<ls>R. 1. 94.</ls>

a manual of ritual
in the form of Sūtras.
